policies.policy_name: Obtain User and Reservation Details Before Cancellation
policies.description: The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons).
references: The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)
violating_examples: An agent attempts to cancel a reservation without first acquiring the user's ID.
The reservation is canceled by the agent using only the reservation ID, without asking for the reason for cancellation.
The agent retrieves the reservation ID but fails to acquire the user ID and proceeds with cancellation.
A reservation is canceled based solely on the fact that the user mentioned a cancellation, without confirming the reservation ID and user ID.
Cancellation is executed without documenting the specific reason for cancellation, thus lacking a record.
The agent begins cancellation after acquiring only the user ID, but not the reservation ID or reason for cancellation.
compliance_examples: The agent obtains the user's ID 'sara_doe_496', the reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', and confirms the reason for cancellation as 'change of plan' before initiating cancellation.
For reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', the agent acquires user ID 'john_smith_789' and validates the cancellation reason 'airline cancelled flight' before proceeding.
Successfully cancels a reservation after acquiring user ID 'emma_doe_123', reservation ID, and the cancellation reason 'other reasons'.
An agent collects all necessary details: user ID 'alex_lee_321', reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', and the cancellation reason 'change of plan', then initiates reservation cancellation.
Prior to cancellation, the agent ensures user ID 'lucy_hair_456', reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', and the reason 'airline cancelled flight' are documented accurately.
The cancellation is processed correctly after verifying the user ID 'noah_hill_908', confirming the reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', and detailing the reason 'other reasons'.

policies.description: All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight.
references: All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight.
violating_examples: A user attempts to cancel a reservation 48 hours after booking, without any airline-initiated flight cancellations.
The user tries to cancel a reservation where the flight is still scheduled and the booking was made 36 hours ago.
Attempting to cancel a reservation 30 hours after booking when the flight has not been canceled by the airline.
Cancellation request is made 25 hours after booking and the flight is on-time according to the airline's schedule.
A user asks to cancel a reservation right after the flight has taken off and the booking was completed two days prior.
compliance_examples: A user cancels a reservation 5 hours after booking when the airline has announced a flight cancellation.
Cancelling a reservation 10 hours after booking without any airline cancellation notice.
Requesting reservation cancellation 23 hours after booking, and no flights have been canceled by the airline.
A reservation is canceled just before the 24-hour mark since booking, and the airline hasn't made any changes to the flight schedule.
User cancels a reservation immediately upon learning the flight has been canceled by the airline, regardless of when the booking was made.

policies.policy_name: Basic Economy and Economy Cancellation Conditions with Insurance
policies.description: Basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met.
references: Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met
violating_examples: A user attempts to cancel their reservation for a basic economy flight without having purchased travel insurance.
An economy flight reservation is cancelled while the user had not opted for travel insurance at the time of booking.
The system processes a cancellation request for a basic economy flight without checking for any travel insurance condition.
A user wants to cancel their reservation for an economy flight, but the booking details reveal that travel insurance was never included.
The reservation system accepts a cancellation request for a basic economy reservation even though no travel insurance was purchased by the user.
compliance_examples: The user cancels a basic economy flight reservation after confirming that travel insurance was purchased at the time of booking.
An economy flight cancellation request is processed correctly after verifying that the travel insurance condition is met.
The system checks and processes the cancellation for a basic economy flight, ensuring that travel insurance is confirmed to be part of the reservation.
A user successfully cancels their economy reservation after confirming with the system that travel insurance was included, thus meeting the cancellation conditions.
A cancellation request for a basic economy flight is executed as the travel insurance details associated with the reservation verify policy compliance.

policies.description: Business flights can always be cancelled.
references: Business flights can always be cancelled.
violating_examples: A user attempts to cancel a reservation with the reservation ID 'YTG53P', which is an economy class reservation, expecting it to comply with the Business Flight Cancellation policy, but it gets rejected because the flight is not classified as a business flight.

Another user submits a cancellation request for a reservation ID 'XPV97Q' without verifying if the flight is in the business class category, mistakenly assuming any reservation can be cancelled under this policy.

A third user tries to cancel a 'premium economy' flight with reservation ID 'LKM23X', wrongly believing premium economy flights fall under business flights, hence violating the policy that only applies to business class.
compliance_examples: A user cancels a reservation with ID 'ABC123' for a flight booked in business class, seamlessly adhering to the Business Flight Cancellation policy, as business flights are explicitly allowed to be cancelled at any time.

Another user utilizes the cancel_reservation tool with reservation ID 'XYZ456' knowing the reservation is for a business class flight, correctly following the policy which permits cancellation of business class reservations.

A user checks the reservation class linked to reservation ID 'FGH789' and confirms it is a business class booking, then successfully cancels the reservation, clearly abiding by the Business Flight Cancellation policy.

policies.policy_name: API Does Not Check Cancellation Rules
policies.description: The API does not check cancellation rules for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API.
references: The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!
violating_examples: An agent calls the cancel_reservation API without verifying if the cancellation is allowed based on the user's fare rules, resulting in cancellation of a non-refundable fare.
The agent cancels a reservation without checking if there are any penalty charges applicable for cancellations at this stage, leading to unexpected charges to the user.
The agent proceeds to use the cancel_reservation API to cancel a flight reservation that is within the lockout period where cancellations are not permitted.
An agent uses the cancel_reservation API for a reservation without confirming if the cancellation is eligible based on the airline's policy on cancellations for group bookings.
Calling cancel_reservation for a holiday package after the deadline for cancellations without verifying if exceptions or alterations are allowed.
compliance_examples: Before calling the cancel_reservation API, an agent checks the user's fare terms on non-refundable tickets and confirms that the reservation is eligible for cancellation.
Prior to using the cancel_reservation API, the agent reviews the penalty terms associated with the booking and informs the user about applicable charges before proceeding.
The agent verifies that the reservation is outside the lockout period, allowing cancellations, before using the cancel_reservation API to cancel the booking.
An agent ensures compliance with airline policies by verifying the eligibility of cancellation for a group booking before invoking the cancel_reservation API.
An agent reviews holiday package terms to confirm that the cancellation is permitted within the specified timeframe before calling cancel_reservation.

policies.description: The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.
references: The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.
violating_examples: A user requests to cancel the reservation with ID 'ZFA04Y', but upon checking, it is found that one of the flight segments within the trip has already been flown. Instead of transferring the user to a human agent, the agent proceeds with the cancellation.

An agent attempts to cancel a trip where the reservation ID is '8JX2WO' despite realizing that the outbound flight segment was taken last week, mistakenly processing the cancellation instead of transferring.

The agent receives the request to cancel reservation ID 'HTX9PL'. The agent ignores the completion status of the trip and processes the cancellation directly, even though the return flight already occurred yesterday.
compliance_examples: The agent receives a request to cancel reservation ID '5LQ7PD'. The agent verifies the trip status and notes that no segments of the trip have been flown yet, therefore successfully processing the cancellation.

A user wants to cancel their reservation with ID 'WORE50'. The agent checks the flight details and sees that all segments are scheduled for next month, thus adhering to the policy by canceling the reservation.

The agent receives a request to cancel reservation ID '7AC3XZ'. After reviewing flight history, it is confirmed that the flights were scheduled but none were flown due to a change of plans. The agent correctly cancels the reservation.

policies.description: The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.
references: The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.
violating_examples: A user calls to cancel a reservation and expects the refund in their bank account immediately after cancellation, not adhering to the 5 to 7 business days policy.

A user cancels their reservation and assumes the refund will be processed to a different payment method than originally used, disregarding the restriction that refunds must go to the original payment method.
The system attempts to issue a refund to the user within the same day of reservation cancellation without following the 5 to 7 business days policy timeframe.
compliance_examples: Upon reservation cancellation, the user acknowledges and understands that the refund process will take 5 to 7 business days to appear in their original payment method, complying with the policy.
The cancellation tool processes a refund request ensuring it is scheduled to the original payment method and communicated that it will take between 5 to 7 business days for completion.
A user is correctly informed via email that after canceling their reservation, the refund will be issued to their original payment method and should expect it within 5 to 7 business days.

policies.policy_name: Explicit User Confirmation for Booking Database Actions
policies.description: Before taking any actions that update the booking database, you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.
references: Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.
violating_examples: A user requests to cancel the reservation by providing the reservation ID 'ZFA04Y', but the system cancels it immediately without asking the user for confirmation.
The system lists the action details for canceling the reservation with ID 'ZFA04Y', but proceeds to cancel it without receiving explicit 'yes' confirmation from the user.
Upon receiving a request to cancel reservation '8JX2WO', the system fails to list the details of the action to the user and directly cancels the reservation.
The system prompts the user for confirmation by listing the action to cancel reservation 'ZFA04Y', but when the user responds with 'no', the system cancels the reservation anyway.
User enters the reservation ID '9KX5LM' to cancel, no details are shown about the action and the system proceeds to cancel it without an explicit 'yes' from the user.
compliance_examples: The system receives a request to cancel reservation 'ZFA04Y'. It lists the reservation details and the cancellation action, asking the user for explicit confirmation. After receiving a 'yes' response from the user, it proceeds to cancel the reservation.

Upon receiving a cancellation request for reservation '8JX2WO', the system lists the details, clarifies that the reservation will be fully canceled, and explicitly asks the user if they wish to proceed. The user responds with 'yes', so the system cancels the reservation.

A user provides the reservation ID '7LY3RS' to cancel. The system displays all details related to the reservation and cancellation process, waits for the user's explicit confirmation 'yes', and only then cancels the reservation.

The system receives an input to cancel reservation 'ZFA04Y'. It outlines the cancellation details, highlights the impact of the action, and requests the user's explicit confirmation 'yes'. Only after receiving confirmation does it proceed with cancellation.

When the user expresses desire to cancel reservation ID '5UC7TY', the system shows the reservation and transaction details comprehensively, asks for a 'yes' from the user to confirm the full cancellation of the booking, then proceeds with the cancellation upon reception of consent.
